actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.
Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-24.
Measure called up as privileged matter in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #24 (249-163).

official_title: A resolution providing funds for the Committee on Rules.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-24) Authorizes expenditures, not in excess of $519,000, by the House Committee on Rules in carrying out its duties during the first session of the 96th Congress. Limits spending for the services of consultants or organizations to $10,000 and for specialized training of staff personnel to $5,000. Prohibits any part of these funds from being available for expenditure in connection with study of any subject which is being investigated for the same purpose by any other committee of the House. Terminates the funds authorized by this resolution on January 3, 1980.

titles.title: A resolution providing funds for the Committee on Rules.
